The World-Honored One is most distinguished, having well severed the seeds of afflictions,
Immeasurable supreme merits are all gathered in the TathÄgata's body.
Only the Buddha can be taken refuge in, praised, and served.
Those who contemplate in accordance with principle should abide in this teaching.
The World-Protectors have already eliminated the habits of evil afflictions,
Merit and wisdom are both perfected, only the Honored One does not fall back.
Even if one gives rise to evil views and harbors resentment towards the Honored One,
Searching for faults in his physical and verbal actions, none can be found.
It is recorded that I have attained a human body, hearing the Dharma and giving rise to joy,
Like a blind turtle in the great ocean encountering a yoke hole.
Forgetfulness always follows, deluded karma falls into a deep pit,
Therefore, I use words to praise the Buddha's true merits.
The Muni's immeasurable realm, the sage's virtues are boundless,
In seeking self-benefit, I now praise a small part.
I respectfully bow to the wisdom without teacher, the rare nature of various things,
Merit, wisdom, and majestic light, who can know the quantity?
The TathÄgata's virtues are limitless, unequaled and indescribable,
I now seek blessings and benefits, and praise with nominal words.
My wisdom power is slight, the Buddha's virtues are boundless,
I only pray for the great compassion to rescue me from my helpless state.
Enemies and friends are all equal, arising great compassion without conditions,
Universally in the realm of sentient beings, always acting as a true good friend.
One can give up even one's inner wealth, let alone outer wealth,
The Honored One has no stingy mind, fulfilling the wishes of those who seek.
Using one's body to protect others' bodies, using one's life to redeem others' lives,
Completely saving a single dove, rejoicing without stinginess.
The Honored One does not fear evil paths, nor does he crave good destinies,
But only for the mind to be clear and pure, the precepts are thus accomplished.
Always avoiding all crookedness, always befriending the honest,
All karmic natures are empty, abiding only in the ultimate truth.
When suffering afflicts one's body, the Honored One is able to calmly consider,
With right wisdom, cutting off all delusions, giving rise to compassion for all faults.
Risking one's life to save others from danger, giving rise to immeasurable joy,
Like suddenly reviving from death, this joy surpasses that.
Enemies harming one's body, always afflicting at all times,
Not observing their faults, always giving rise to a great compassionate mind.
The seed of perfect enlightenment, always cherished by the mind,
The great hero's unsurpassed wisdom, none can equal it.
The unsurpassed fruit of enlightenment, ascetic practice is its cause.
Because of this, disregarding the body, one diligently cultivates all excellent practices.
Nobility and poverty, equally guiding with great compassion,
Among all distinctions, there is no thought of high or low.
The fruit of excellent bliss and concentration, the mind has no attachment,
Universally delivering all beings, great compassion is uninterrupted.
Although the Honored One encounters extreme suffering, he does not seek pleasure,
The excellent wisdom and all merits, unsurpassed, none can share.
The various dharmas of defilement and purity, discarding the false and taking the true,
Like the pure king of geese, drinking the milk and discarding the water.
For innumerable koá¹­is of kalpas, bravely heading towards enlightenment,
In those lives, sacrificing the body to seek the wonderful Dharma.
The number of three asaá¹ƒkhyeya eons, diligently practicing without slacking,
Holding this as the supreme companion, thus attaining wondrous enlightenment.
The Honored One has no jealous mind, towards the inferior removing thoughts of contempt,
Equanimous without conflict or dispute, the supreme practices all perfected.
The Honored One only values the practice of causes, not seeking the perfection of fruition,
Universally cultivating all supreme deeds, the myriad virtues naturally fulfilled.
Diligent in cultivating the Dharma of liberation, transcending and soaring above the peak of all practices,
Whether sitting, lying down, or walking, there is no place that is not a supreme field of blessings.
Extracting and removing all defiled faults, increasing and growing pure virtues,
This is due to the accumulation of practices, only the Honored One is supreme.
All blessings are completely fulfilled, all faults are completely removed,
The TathÄgata's pure Dharma body, all dust and habits already severed.
The accumulation of provisions is further accumulated, the merit returns to the body of the Tamer,
If you want to seek a simile, nothing can equal the Buddha.
Thoroughly observing all worlds, with many calamities, obstacles, and afflictions,
Even if there is a little bit of goodness, it is easily obtained as a counterpart;
Far removed from all faults, tranquil and unmoving,
The most supreme wholesome roots, nothing can serve as a simile.
The TathÄgata's wisdom is profound and far-reaching, with no bottom and no boundary,
Worldly matters compared to the Buddha's body, like a cow's hoofprint compared to the great ocean.
Deep benevolence supports all, with nothing comparable in the world,
The great earth bearing heavy burdens, compared to this it is truly light.
The darkness of ignorance has already been removed, the sage's light shines everywhere,
Worldly wisdom cannot serve as a simile, like a firefly compared to sunlight.
The TathÄgata's three karmas are pure, like the autumn moon in a clear pond,
Worldly purity compared to the Buddha's body, both become the nature of dust and turbidity.
As for the various supreme events in the world mentioned above,
The Buddha's teachings are far superior, while worldly affairs are pitiable.
The precious collection of the holy Dharma, with the Buddha at its peak,
Among the unsurpassed and incomparable, only the Buddha is equal to the Buddha.
The ocean of the TathÄgata's holy wisdom, I praise a small part according to my wishes,
With vulgar words praising the supreme virtues, I feel much shame in the face of this.
At that time, the world witnessed the subjugation of MÄra, and all of them submitted in surrender,
Observing their same true nature, I consider them equal to a light feather.
Even if there were a great battle, wisdom and bravery could subdue them,
But the holy virtues surpass the world, subduing them is not a metaphor.
Immediately after the subjugation of MÄra, in the latter part of the night,
He severed the habitual tendencies of afflictions, and all supreme virtues were perfected.
The holy wisdom removes all darkness, surpassing the light of a thousand suns,
Subjugating all heterodox schools, rare and incomparable.
The three wholesome roots are perfected, forever extinguishing greed, anger, and delusion,
The seeds and habits are all eliminated, pure and incomparable.
The sublime Dharma is always praised, and improper Dharma is always rejected,
In this right and wrong, the mind has no aversion or attachment.
To the assembly of noble disciples, and to the teachers and disciples of non-Buddhist paths,
In their opposition and compliance, the Buddha's mind is always impartial.
In virtue, the mind is unattached, and the virtuous are also not greedy,
Excellent, extremely pure, the sage's wisdom is always perfectly clean.
The faculties are always tranquil and still, forever free from deluded thoughts,
In all sense objects, direct perception is due to direct observation.
Contemplation and wisdom reach the ultimate truth, not fathomed by ordinary fools,
Skillfully establishing language, realizing the state beyond words.
The light of tranquil unobstruction is pure and radiant,
Its wondrous form is rarely seen in the world - who would not give rise to a reverent mind?
If one sees it for the first time, or if one always beholds it,
The wondrous marks are never different - all rejoice before and after.
The body of supreme majestic virtue, the beholders' minds are never sated,
Even if one gazes for innumerable eons, one still looks up in admiration as if seeing it for the first time.
The virtuous essence that is relied upon, and the virtuous mind that relies,
The nature and characteristics are both fused, the able and the object are originally non-dual.
Such are the virtues of the Well-Gone One, all gathered in the TathÄgata's body,
Apart from the Buddha's body of excellent marks, there is no other place they can abide.
Due to my blessings from past lives, I have fortunately encountered the Tamer and Guide,
I look up and praise the Mountain of Merits, from afar repaying the Honored One's prediction.
All kinds of sentient beings, all are sustained by afflictions,
Only the Buddha can skillfully eliminate them, because of his compassion abiding in the world for a long time.
Who should first pay homage? Only the Buddha, the greatly compassionate honored one,
His sacred virtue surpasses the world, and he abides in birth and death out of compassionate vows.
The honored one abides in the blissful state of tranquility, yet dwells in the turbid world for the sake of sentient beings,
For a long time, he has diligently cultivated for eons, with a compassionate mind for all.
Returning from the truth to benefit the secular world, he is drawn forth by compassion,
Like a dragon emerging from its hiding place, bringing forth clouds and pouring down sweet rain.
Always abiding in the supreme meditative state, he views enemies and friends equally,
Even violent and clamorous people throw themselves into the protection of his sacred virtue.
With spiritual powers, he roars like a lion, proclaiming himself the honored one of the three realms,
Having long since become weary of fame and reputation, he praises himself out of compassion.
Always cultivating practices to benefit others, he never has a thought of benefiting himself,
His compassionate thoughts pervade all sentient beings, yet he has no partiality towards himself.
Compassion and vows are boundless, transforming beings according to their faculties,
Benefiting everywhere, like scattering sacrificial food.
Deeply contemplating all, never abandoning them for a moment,
Benefiting others, yet encountering insults, due to faults, not created by the Buddha.
The compassionate voice expounds wondrous meanings, sincere and true, not false speech,
Broad and concise, according to the capacities of beings, half and full, changing with the times.
If one hears the Honored One's teachings, who would not praise it as rare and wondrous?
Even if one harbors evil thoughts, the wise all return to faith.
Meaning and words are always skillful, or coarse speech may be spoken,
Benefiting all without falsehood, therefore both become true and wondrous.
Gentle and coarse, following circumstances to transform beings,
The sage's unobstructed mind, of one flavor, all equal.
Excellent indeed, the stainless karma, skillful like a fine craftsman,
Attaining this subtle and wondrous body, he expounds these precious and rare words.
Those who see him all rejoice, and upon hearing his teachings, their minds are opened.
With a beautiful countenance, he proclaims wondrous words, like the moon flowing with sweet dew.
The cloud of compassion showers the rain of Dharma, able to clear away the dust of defiled desires.
Like that golden-winged king, he swallows up the poisons of the nagas,
Able to destroy the darkness of ignorance, like the light of a thousand suns,
Crushing the mountain of arrogance, like the thunderbolt of Indra.
The present realization is not false or mistaken, and meditative concentration removes the chaotic mind.
Truly and correctly practicing well, the three matters are all perfectly fulfilled.
First hearing what the Buddha has said, the mind rejoices and is already enlightened.
From this, good thoughts arise, eliminating all defilements and stains.
Encountering suffering, he is able to comfort and console, and he frightens those who are negligent and careless.
Attached to pleasure, he encourages a mind of disgust and loathing, guiding and instructing according to the situation.
The wise attain the joy of the Dharma, those of middling faculties give rise to superior understanding,
The shallow and inferior give rise to faith in the Buddha's words, the Honored One's speech universally benefits.
He skillfully uproots all wrong views, leading them to enter nirvana,
He can wash away karmic offenses and defilements, due to the Honored One's bestowal of the Dharma rain.
The Omniscient One is unobstructed, always abiding in right mindfulness,
The Tathagata's predictions are always not false or mistaken.
There are no non-places or non-times, nor are there any non-vessels turning,
The Honored One's speech is not issued in vain, all who hear it diligently practice.
The one path of excellent skillful means, without admixture, can be cultivated and studied,
From beginning to end it is entirely good, other teachings are all lacking in this.
Such one-sided goodness, the insane and foolish give rise to slanderous thoughts,
If this teaching gives rise to resentment, there is no greater enemy than this.
For eons he has been deluded by the masses, undergoing various bitter sufferings,
Even if this teaching is not good, one should still cultivate mindfulness of the Buddha.
How much more so for that which greatly benefits and proclaims the profound and wondrous meaning?
Even if one's head is on fire, one should first save this teaching.
Self-mastery, enlightenment, and blissful joy, the sagely virtues are always tranquil,
All arise from this teaching, realizing the place beyond words.
The true teaching of the World-Honored One, the heretical schools tremble upon hearing it,
The demon king is filled with distress, humans and gods give rise to supreme joy.
The great earth is without discrimination, yet it can universally support all equally,
The sagely teachings benefit all beings, both the righteous and the heretical receive blessings.
Having briefly heard what the Buddha has said, the vajra seed has already been formed,
Even if one has not yet left the cage, one will ultimately transcend the path of death.
Having heard the Dharma, one contemplates the meaning, and practices it as it is,
The three levels of wisdom are perfected, other teachings do not have this.
Has wondrously conformed to the true and perfect principle.ğŸ”½If one does not diligently cultivate this teaching,
What resentment could surpass this?
If one hears it for a moment, thirst and craving are removed, and faith arises in wrong views.
Listeners give rise to a joyful mind, and based on this, they perfect pure precepts.
When born, all rejoice; when growing up, the world is all delighted.
The great teaching benefits all beings, and when demonstrating extinction, it gives rise to sorrow.
Praising and singing eliminate various poisons; recollecting it brings forth joy.
Seeking it gives rise to the light of wisdom; understanding it purifies the mind.
Those who encounter it are made noble; respectfully serving it, the superior mind arises.
Attending to it brings about the causes of blessings; personally revering it removes worries and suffering.
Precepts are complete and pure; meditation makes the mind still and tranquil.

The honored form, the honored teachings, and the honored realized Dharma,
Among seeing, hearing, thinking, and knowing, this treasure is the most supreme.
Drifting and flowing, it becomes an island, always protecting those who harm themselves,
For the fearful, it becomes a refuge, leading them to liberation.
Pure precepts form a wonderful vessel, a good field gives rise to excellent fruits,
Good friends are able to benefit, and the life of wisdom is accomplished through this.
Practicing kindness and patience, those who see it all rejoice,
Extensively gathering the mind of kindness and compassion, merits and virtues have no bounds.
Body and speech are without faults or evil, love and respect arise from this,
Auspiciousness, various benefits and advantages, all rely on the virtues of the Well-Gone One.
The guide is able to skillfully lead, causing those who fall into arrogance to be diligent,
Equanimous concentration adjusts the crooked mind, and the deluded path returns to the right path.
For those whose wholesome roots are mature, they are driven by the three vehicles,
For those who are stubborn and unruly, they are temporarily abandoned out of compassion.
Able to provide peace and happiness to those in distress, encouraging the cultivation of goodness,
Compassionate towards suffering beings, benefiting and delighting all kinds of beings.ğŸ”½Giving rise to thoughts of kindness towards those who do harm, feeling sorrow for those who go astray,
Giving rise to thoughts of compassion towards the violent and tyrannical, the sagely virtues cannot be praised enough.
Your kindness is deeper than the boundless, known to all in the world,
Yet here you give rise to resentment, the Honored One always gives rise to compassion.
Sacrificing yourself to save all, not giving rise to worry over your own affairs,
For those who have fallen, you are able to provide support and protection.
Creating kindness that extends to both worlds, surpassing all worldly beings,
Always illuminating in the darkness, the Honored One is the wick of the lamp of wisdom.
What is enjoyed by humans and gods, differing according to the type,
Only the Honored One's taste of the true Dharma, equal and without distinction.
Not observing clan, race, complexion, strength, or youthfulness,
Wherever there are people with wholesome roots, those who seek are all fulfilled.
Extensively manifesting various marvels, arising great compassion without conditions,
The holy assembly and humans and devas, with palms joined, all draw near.
Alas, the fear of birth and death, the Buddha's appearance then shines brightly,
Benefiting all sentient beings, all able to fulfill their wishes.
Dwelling together with evil people, destroying joy and taking on worry and danger,
Slandering, afflicting, and harming one's body, yet as if receiving supreme virtues.
For the sake of beings, practicing diligently and painfully, never having a mind of attachment,
The World-Honored One's rare and wonderful virtues, difficult to express in words.
The Honored One roams in dangerous paths, horse-feed and ox-hoofs,
Practicing austerities for six years, peacefully enduring with a mind of no retreat.
The Honored One dwells in the most supreme position, with compassion transforming the multitude of beings,
Even if encountering lowly people, body and speech surpassing in humility and respect,
Or in a venerable and noble position, they never had an arrogant mind,
Humble and respectful like a servant, serving sentient beings.
With billions of different dispositions and hundreds of thousands of debates,
The Tathagata's compassionate and kind voice, answering one question, cuts off all doubts.
His kindness surpasses that of parents, yet he arouses deep resentment against his virtue,
The Venerable One views the most hostile environment as if it were the heaviest kindness.
Enemies turn to harm the Venerable One, but the Venerable One turns to be kind to enemies,
They always seek the Buddha's faults, but the Buddha regards them as kindness.
Heretics with jealous minds invite him, offering poisoned food and a pit of fire,
With compassionate vows, he transforms it into a clear pool, changing poison into nectar.
With forbearance, he subdues anger; with true words, he dissolves slander and criticism;
With the power of kindness, he subdues Mara and enemies; with right wisdom, he subdues the poison of heterodoxy.
The deluded masses, from beginningless kalpas, have cultivated evil and formed their natures,
Only the Venerable One's perfect practice of the sublime way can turn a single thought into goodness.
Gentleness subdues violence, generosity breaks through stinginess and greed,
Kind words subdue harsh speech, only the Venerable One's skillful means are supreme.
Nanda subdued great arrogance, Angulimala gave rise to a compassionate mind,
The untamed are able to be well-tamed, who would not praise this rarity?
Only the Venerable One's noble disciples, the flavor of the Dharma delights their spirits,
A grass seat is considered comfortable, a golden bed is not valued.
Well understanding faculties, desires, and natures, guiding and transforming in accordance with capacities,
Some wait for requests, some speak on their own without being asked.
First presenting giving, precepts, and so forth, gradually purifying the mind,
Later discussing the true Dharma, ultimately causing complete realization.
In places of fear and drifting, only the Buddha can be taken refuge in,
The courageous and greatly compassionate Honored One rescues all beings.
The cloud of the body pervades the Dharma realm, and the Dharma rain sprinkles the dust-like lands,
The responsive manifestations are each different, following the capacities there are differences.
Pure and without conflict, only the Honored One can be served and revered,
Extensively benefiting humans and gods, all should make offerings.
The body and speech are without action, skillfully transforming pervades the various lands,
What is spoken accords with the wondrous characteristics, this virtue is possessed only by the Honored One.
For a long time cultivating the purity of the three karmas, the wondrous auspicious signs manifest boundlessly,
Universally observing all worlds, never before has there been this supreme virtue.
All the more so for those of extreme evil, purely practicing the utmost compassion,
Extensively benefiting all beings, courageous and diligent in effort.

Those assemblies of sages, for their own sake they cultivate and study,
By abandoning the mind of seeking rebirth, one is not called one who repays debts.
Having awakened from the sleep of ignorance, one's compassionate observation pervades all directions,
Bearing the burden with uplifted diligence, one should draw near to the holy and good.
The harm caused by the enemy Mara, the Buddha's power has already eliminated,
Among the virtues of fearlessness, this only reveals a small part.
With a compassionate mind, one transforms all, the holy intention is free from seeking,
Benefiting and bringing joy without exception, one's ability to serve is all completed.
The Tathagata's supreme and wonderful Dharma, if it can be moved,
Devadatta and Subhadra, should not have been converted by this teaching.
In the beginningless cycle of birth and death, we have been mutually harmful to each other,
Because of this, the Buddha appears in the world, revealing and transforming sentient beings.
In the Deer Park, he delivered Ajnatakaundinya, in the Hard-to-Conquer Grove, he transformed Subhadra,
The conditions for this land have ended, there is no other debt to be drawn upon.
The wheel of Dharma has long been turned, awakening the deluded masses,
With countless disciples receiving teachings, all able to benefit the three realms of existence.
With the supreme vajra samÄdhi, he shatters his own solid body,
Yet does not abandon great compassion, transforming himself and distributing [his remains].
Having fulfilled the practices of benefiting both self and others, the two form bodies are perfected,
Saving and embracing the icchantikas, revealing the Buddha-nature at the twin trees.
Compassion pervades the three realms of existence, the form and appearance responding to all directions,
With a body divided into grains of rice, he then abides in perfect quiescence.
Excellent and extraordinary practices, a rare body of merit and virtue,
The great enlightenment and all Dharma gates, never before seen in the world.
Grace flows universally to all sentient beings, body and speech always in silence,
Yet the ignorant turn their backs on the Buddha's grace, giving rise to slander and anger towards the Honored One.
The treasury of the Dharma aggregate is truly boundless, the source of virtues and ocean of blessings truly difficult to fathom,
If there are sentient beings who have paid homage to the Honored One, paying homage to them is also called good homage.
The holy virtues and spiritual powers are inexhaustible, and my inferior wisdom is likened to a tiny particle,
Wishing to praise the merits of the TathÄgata's mountain, I am afraid of retreating due to the steep cliff and stop here.
The immeasurable, innumerable, and boundless realms, the inconceivable, unseeable, and unobtainable principles,
Are only fully understood by the Buddha's holy wisdom. How can they be praised by ordinary foolish people?
Every hair and every mark fills the Dharma realm, every practice and every virtue pervades the source of the mind,
Pure and vast, likened to a fragrant pond, able to cure sentient beings' thirst of afflictions.
I praise the ocean of merits of the Sage, relying on this wholesome karma to aspire to bodhi,
Universally wishing all sentient beings to give rise to the supreme mind, forever leaving behind the false consciousness of ordinary foolish people.
